$HYPE


HYPE has been in a sustained downtrend from highs around $55,000+ down to current levels around $20,821 - a massive drop of over 60%. The chart shows a clear pattern of lower highs and lower lows throughout late 2024 into early 2025.


Current Situation:


- Price is testing a support zone around $20,000-$21,000 (highlighted in beige)
- There‚Äôs a horizontal resistance level at $28,886 that‚Äôs been respected multiple times
- Recent price action shows some consolidation after the steep decline
- A potential support level (Ts) is marked at $20,821


Key Levels:


- Resistance: $25,414 (Csd level), then $28,886, and ultimately $30,000
- Support: $20,000-$21,000 zone (critical level)


The question now is whether this support holds or if we see further downside. Any bounce would need to reclaim the $25-28k range with volume to suggest a trend change. Until then, the overall structure remains bearish.


Not financial advice - always do your own research and risk management.

Breaking news from yesterday

- Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX to merge with xAI ahead of a Q4 IPO

- OpenAI Prepares for Potential Q4 IPO

- Bit Digital announced it will fully wind down its Bitcoin mining operations to concentrate on Ethereum and AI-related strategies.

- US Senate reached spending deal to avoid government shutdown 

- Trump to replace Powell with Kevin Warsh as new Fed Reserve Chair reached 81% on Polymarket 

- Yesterday, a sudden market crash wiped out trillions, with Gold plunging 8.2% and losing nearly $3T, Silver down 12.2% and losing about $760B, the S&P 500 falling 1.23% and erasing $780B, and the Nasdaq dropping over 2.5% and wiping out roughly $760B.

- HYPE is live on Solana powered by Sunrise

- MegaETH co-founder Namik Muduroglu said over half of MEGA‚Äôs 10B supply will unlock only after key protocol milestones are met, with distribution tied to KPIs like ecosystem growth, performance, and decentralization, rather than time based schedule

- The Senate Agriculture Committee voted to advance crypto market structure legislation

- Intern steps down as Monad director of growth 

- Monero Mahesh announced the launch of EV3 Venture Fund II, an oversubscribed $61.74 million early-stage fund focused on backing founders with long-term ambition. 

- Bybit CEO Ben Zhou said the exchange will launch IBAN-based fiat accounts in February, supporting 18 currencies and offering cross-border transfers and neobank-style features beyond trading

- 21Shares launched Solana liquid staking ETP for European investors.

- Metaplanet CEO Simon Gerovich announced a ¬•12.2B ($79.5M) share issuance, with total fundraising potentially reaching ¬•21B ($137M), to primarily expand the company‚Äôs Bitcoin holdings

- Talos announced a $45 million extension to its Series B round, bringing total Series B funding to $150 million

- Optimism governance approved a buyback plan to use 50% of Superchain revenue starting in February to repurchase OP tokens

- Optimism launched OP Enterprise, a production-grade, turnkey blockchain stack that lets companies build onchain businesses with full revenue control

- OSL Group, announced a $200 million equity financing to strengthen its capital base and accelerate global expansion

- Andre Cronje‚Äôs Flying Tulip raised $75.5M in Series A from Amber Group, Fasanara Digital, and Paper Ventures at a $1 billion FDV

- The CFTC and SEC announced a joint initiative called Project Crypto, aimed at coordinating and modernizing cryptocurrency oversight.

- Hyperliquid plans to release 140k tokens for team unlocks in the coming months, significantly lower than the 1.2 million tokens released last month

- The US Department of Justice has secured legal ownership of more than $400 million in cryptocurrencies, real estate, and other assets tied to the Helix darknet mixing service.

- Kazakhstan‚Äôs central bank investment arm, NIC, plans to strengthen national crypto reserves using seized cryptocurrencies, gold, and foreign currency, allocating $350 million via five hedge funds

- In 2016, TheDAO was hacked for 3.6M ETH, prompting Ethereum‚Äôs historic hard fork to recover most of the funds while some remained dormant for years. Today, TheDAO has relaunched committing over 75,000 ETH ($220M) to strengthen ETH security

- CFTC withdrew rule proposal against sports related event contracts and draft new regulations fr prediction markets
